thread.title: Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more
thread.title_full: Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more

title: Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more While the Ravens took on the Browns, a few special former players made the trip to the place that established Baltimore's football dominance. Post to Facebook Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more While the Ravens took on the Browns, a few special former players made the trip to the place that established Baltimore's football dominance.   WUSA9.com: http://on.wusa9.com/1LssyL7   Join the Conversation To   Baltimore NFL greats of the past recognized once more Grace E Olson, WUSA9 12:26 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 The Colts team of the 1950s established football dominance in Baltimore. (Photo: Olson, Grace) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
While the Ravens took on the Browns at home this past Sunday, a few special figures from Baltimore's football past made the trip to M&T Stadium and watched on with reminiscent eyes. 
Halfback Lenny Moore, defensive end Gino Marchetti, and wide receiver Raymond Berry, members of the dominating Baltimore Colts teams of the 1950s and 1960s, joined football greats of the present during halftime for a special ring presentation put on by the NFL Hall of Fame. Because rings are now constructed with a lot more "bling", the NFL launched an initiative to present Hall of Fame players with new hardware, constructed with nearly two carats of diamonds arranged in the shape of a football. 
Moore, Marchetti and Berry played a large role in building a meaningful football presence in Baltimore, playing their way to Super Bowl championships in 1958 and 1959. For that reason, they requested that the presentation be had in Maryland, rather than in Indianapolis. 
Before kickoff, I spoke with NFL Hall of Fame President David Baker about the importance of the players' return. 
Former Baltimore Colt Lenny Moore runs around the end in a 1960 game against the Rams. (Photo: Olson, Grace) NFL Hall of Fame President, David Baker, describes the contributions former Baltimore Colts Lenny Moore, Gino Marchetti, and Raymond Berry made in the football sphere to the city of Baltimore.
